title: Calories in Roasted Pepper
meta_description: Discover calories in roasted pepper, including macros, fiber, and nutrition facts per serving, plus tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Medium red bell pepper (approx. 119 g), dry-roasted, peeled, seeds removed, no added oil, salt, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pepper type (red/green), size, roasting method, and any added ingredients. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium roasted red pepper provides about 31 kcal, mainly from carbs with good fiber content.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during roasting
Use green bell pepper instead of red

faqs.q: How many calories in one roasted pepper?
faqs.a: About 31 kcal for a medium red roasted bell pepper.

faqs.q: Are roasted peppers low in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, one medium has ~7 g carbs, with 2.4 g fiber and 4.6 g natural sugars.

faqs.q: What's the protein in roasted pepper?
faqs.a: Minimal at ~1.1 g per medium pepper; it's mostly a veggie carb source.
Very low, only 0.3 g total fat per pepper, with no cholesterol.

faqs.q: How does roasting affect pepper calories?
faqs.a: Roasting concentrates nutrients slightly but keeps calories low (~25-30 kcal per 100 g); avoid added oils to stay lean.
